BiblioData.Title: TUNABLE WAVELENGTH LIGHT EMITTING DIODE

Applicant.Name: AGENCY SCIENCE TECH & RES [SG]
AGENCY FOR SCIENCE, TECHNOLOGY AND RESEARCH

BiblioData.Abstract: A light emitting diode and a method of fabricating a light emitting diode. the diode comprises a first set of multiple quantum wells (MQWs), each of the MQWs of the first set comprising a wetting layer providing nucleation sites for quantum dots (QDs) or QD-like structures in a well layer of said each MQW; and a second set of MQWs, each of the MQWs of the second set formed so as to exhibit a photoluminescence (PL) peak wavelength shifted compared to the MQWs of the first set.

Claims.P: CLAIMS

1. A light emitting diode comprising: a first set of multiple quantum wells (MQWs), each of the MQWs of the first set comprising a wetting layer providing nucleation sites for quantum dots (QDs) or QD-like structures in a well layer of said each MQW; and a second set of MQWs, each of the MQWs of the second set formed so as to exhibit a photoluminescence (PL) peak wavelength shifted compared to the MQWs of the first set.
2. The light emitting diode as claimed in claim 1, wherein the QDs or QD-like structures comprise In atoms.
3. The light emitting diode as claimed in claims 1 or 2, wherein the first set of MQWs comprises about 3 to 5 MQWs.

4. The light emitting diode as claimed in any one of the preceding claims, wherein the second set of MQWs comprises about 2 to 5 MQWs. 5. The light emitting diode as claimed in any one of the preceding claims, wherein each of the MQWs of the second set comprises a Ga-based barrier layer and an Ga-based well layer formed on the Ga-based barrier layer.

6. The light emitting diode as claimed in any one of the preceding claims, wherein each of the MQWs of the first set comprises a Ga-based barrier layer, an InGa-based wetting layer formed on the Ga-based barrier layer, and a Ga-based well layer formed on the InGa-wetting layer.

7. The light emitting diode as claimed in claim 6, wherein the first set of MQWs are formed on an n-type doped Ga-based layer, the second set of MQWs is formed on the first set of MQWs, a Ga-based capped layer is formed on the second set of MQWs, and a p-type doped Ga-based layer is formed on the Ga-based capped layer.

8. The light emitting diode as claimed in claim 7, further comprising electrical contacts for contacting the n-type doped Ga-based layer and the p-type doped Ga-based layer respectively. 9. The light emitting diode as claimed in any one of the preceding claims, wherein the first and second sets of MQWs are supported on a substrate.
10. The light emitting diode as claimed in any one of the preceding claims, wherein the MQWs comprise one material system of a group consisting of InGa/Ga, InGa/AIGa, Ga/AIGa and InGa/AllnGa.
11. The light emitting diode as claimed in claim 10, wherein the MQWs comprise the nitride or phosphide of the material system.
12. The light emitting diode as claimed in any one of the preceding claims, wherein a combined PL spectrum of the diode covers a tunable wavelength range of about 400-800nm.

13. A method of fabricating a light emitting diode, the method comprising the steps of: forming a first set of multiple quantum wells (MQWs), each of the MQWs of the first set comprising a wetting layer providing nucleation sites for quantum dots (QDs) or QD-like structures in a well layer of said each MQW; and forming a second set of MQWs, each of the MQWs of the second set formed so as to exhibit a photoluminescence (PL) peak wavelength shifted compared to the MQWs of the first set.
14. The method as claimed in claim 13, wherein the QDs or QD-like structures comprise In atoms.
15. The method as claimed in claims 13 or 14, wherein the first set of MQWs comprises about 3 to 5 MQWs.

16. The method as claimed in any one of claims 13 to 15, wherein the second set of MQWs comprises about 2 to 5 MQWs. 17. The method as claimed in any one of claims 13 to 16, wherein each of the MQWs of the second set comprises a Ga-based barrier layer and an InGa-based well layer formed on the Ga-based barrier layer.

18. The method as claimed in any one of claims 13 to 17, wherein each of the MQWs of the first set comprises a Ga-based barrier layer, an InGa-based wetting layer formed on the Ga-based barrier layer, and a Ga-based well layer formed on the InGa-wetting layer.

19. The method as claimed in claim 18, wherein the first set of MQWs are formed on an n-type doped Ga-based layer, the second set of MQWs is formed on the first set of MQWs, a Ga-based capped layer is formed on the second set of MQWs, and a p-type doped Ga-based layer is formed on the Ga-based capped layer.
20. The method as claimed in claim 19, further comprising forming electrical contacts for contacting the n-type doped Ga-based layer and the p-type doped Ga-based layer respectively.
21. The method as claimed in any one of claims 13 to 20, wherein the first and second sets of MQWs are supported on a substrate.

22. The method as claimed in any one of claims 13 to 21 , wherein the first set of MQWs is formed at a lower temperature than the second set of MQWs. 23. The method as claimed in any one of claims 13 to 22, wherein the first set of MQWs is formed with a higher In precursor flow than the second set of MQWs.
24. The method as claimed in any one of claims 13 to 23, wherein the MQWs comprise one material system of a group consisting of InGa/Ga, InGa/AIGa, Ga/AIGa and InGa/AllnGa.
25. The method as claimed in claim 24, wherein the MQWs comprise the nitride or phosphide of the material system.
